title: Azerbaijanis
summary: Azerbaijanis (/ˌæzərbaɪˈdʒæni, -ɑːni/; Azerbaijani: Azərbaycanlılar, آذربایجانلیلار‎) or Azeris (Azerbaijani: Azərilər, آذریلر‎), also known as Azerbaijani Turks (Azerbaijani: Azərbaycan Türkləri, آذربایجان تۆرکلری‎),[41][42][43] are a Turkic people living mainly in Northwestern Iran and in the sovereign Republic of Azerbaijan, with a mixed cultural heritage, including Caucasian, Iranian and Turkic elements.[2][44][45][46] They are the second-most numerous ethnic group among the Turkic-speaking peoples after Turkish people[47] and are predominantly Shia Muslims.[48] They comprise the largest ethnic group in the Republic of Azerbaijan and the second-largest ethnic group in neighboring Iran and Georgia.[49] They speak the Azerbaijani language, belonging to the Oghuz branch of the Turkic languages.
